nodes.bodyText: This function will trigger another event and retry the message, right? Why in the PR it said the message will not be automatically retried?

Oh yeah, good catch. I changed the design since during the test I find that would be a very bad way if we leave the message there and pray for some new messages coming.
The PR description is about what has been fixed. Let me make it more clear.
Can we have a more detailed error message here?
I agree, it was copy-pasted. Let me make it complete.
The naming here makes me a bit confusing. This message is updated as NEW because it is cannot be processed right? Maybe call it MessageUpdatedAsNew or something.
Good name, let me change it.
same here: what does "new and updated" mean?
"negative" doesn't match if condition.
Good catch, I forget to change the comment after the code change.
We decided to get rid of sleep, right?
I think removing it will be fine. It was from some old code. Let me have a try.
Is this the same thing as the message attribute of retrying? Otherwise, we need an accurate name since it is the retry for state model creation.

It is the same. So in theory it will be applied to the timeout condition too. Although ST message does not have a timeout setup for now, we may have it in the future. So make this name too explicit may be confusing as well. I propose to make it a general retry count for ST messages. But it is debatable. Let me know what's your thought.
Why we dont move this check in the previous block? Since it already does the looping of the msgsToBeUpdated.
Good point, I don't remember any limitation makes me do this. Let me have a try : )
You mean retried and succeeded finally, right?
Fixed.
On my second thought, I think this is dangerous since changed the behavior unnecessarily. Let me just log in this case instead of modifying the original logic.
+1  I was thinking that an additional log for this case would be helpful.
